# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you could write the wrap_string function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width=10)
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) <= text_width 
            append!(line, word)
            append!(line, ' ')
        else
            println(line)
            empty!(line)
            append!(line, word)
            append!(line, ' ')
        end
    end
    println(line) # print out the remaining line after looping through all words
end
```
Example usage: 

```julia
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet"]
text_width = 10
wrap_string(words, text_width)
```
This will output:

```
Lorem dolor
ipsum sit amet
```
